Class Game

java.lang.Object
elements.Game
public class Game extends Object
Represents a chess game, including the board position, move history, and the current state of the game.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    Game.Color
    Enum representing the colors of the chess pieces.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    Position
    currentPosition
    Current position of the chess pieces on the board.
    List<Move>
    gameHistory
    List of moves played during the game.
    int
    halfMoveClock
    Counter for half moves since the last capture or pawn advance.
    boolean
    whiteMoves
    Indicates whether it's White's turn to move.

    • display

      public void display()
      Displays the current game state, including the last move and check status.

    • isCheckForWhite

      public boolean isCheckForWhite()
      Checks if White is in check.
      Returns:
      True if White is in check, false otherwise.

    • isCheckForBlack

      public boolean isCheckForBlack()
      Checks if Black is in check.
      Returns:
      True if Black is in check, false otherwise.

    • isCheckmateForWhite

      public boolean isCheckmateForWhite()
      Checks if White is in checkmate.
      Returns:
      true if White is in checkmate, false otherwise.

    • isCheckmateForBlack

      public boolean isCheckmateForBlack()
      Checks if Black is in checkmate.
      Returns:
      true if Black is in checkmate, false otherwise.

    • possibleMoveFromCheck

      public boolean possibleMoveFromCheck(Game.Color color)
      Determines if a move is possible to escape a check situation.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the player to check for possible moves.
      Returns:
      true if no valid move exists to escape check, false otherwise.

    • isCheckmate

      public boolean isCheckmate(Game.Color color)
      Checks if a player is in checkmate.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the player to check for checkmate.
      Returns:
      true if the player is in checkmate, false otherwise.

    • isStalemateForWhite

      public boolean isStalemateForWhite()
      Checks if White is in stalemate.
      Returns:
      true if White is in stalemate, false otherwise.

    • isStalemateForBlack

      public boolean isStalemateForBlack()
      Checks if Black is in stalemate.
      Returns:
      true if Black is in stalemate, false otherwise.

    • isStalemate

      public boolean isStalemate(Game.Color color)
      Checks if a player is in stalemate.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the player to check for stalemate.
      Returns:
      true if the player is in stalemate, false otherwise.

    • insufficientMaterial

      public boolean insufficientMaterial(Game.Color color)
      Checks if there is insufficient material to continue the game.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the player to check for sufficient material.
      Returns:
      true if there is insufficient material, false otherwise.

    • rule50Moves

      public boolean rule50Moves()
      Checks if the 50-move rule has been reached.
      Returns:
      true if the half-move clock is 50 or more, false otherwise.

    • isDraw

      public boolean isDraw()
      Checks if the game is a draw due to stalemate, insufficient material, or the 50-move rule.
      Returns:
      true if the game is a draw, false otherwise.

    • getPiecesOfColor

      public List<Square> getPiecesOfColor(Game.Color color)
      Retrieves all squares containing pieces of the specified color.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the pieces to find.
      Returns:
      a list of squares containing pieces of the specified color.

    • FENNotation

      public String FENNotation()
      Generates the FEN (Forsyth-Edwards Notation) string representing the current state of the game.
      Returns:
      the FEN string representing the current game state.

    • copy

      public Game copy()
      Creates a deep copy of the current game state.
      Returns:
      a new Game object that is a deep copy of the current game state.

    • destroy

      public void destroy()
      Destroys the current game by clearing all game-related data.
